alert.note: Alert for Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 17 at 6:56AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following area, Taiya River. This includes the cities of Dyea and Skagway. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. Heavy rainfall may increase the risk of rock slide activity near the Skagway dock. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A quick moving but moist atmospheric river continues to move through the the inner channels. As of 6 am, the Taiya River water level is 15.7 feet and rising. There still is a possibly of the river going above minor flood stage of 16.5 feet by Wednesday afternoon. 24 hours rain amounts of 1 to 2 inches have been observed. Over the next 24 hours, an additional 1 to 2 inches is possible. A lull in precipitation is ongoing this morning, but a resurgence in heavier rain will return by late this morning into the early afternoon.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
